While antivirus software and firewalls are often thought of as "nice to haves," they are essential for ensuring the safety of your data and network. You are endangering the well-being of your computer and your personal information if you continue to view an all-encompassing internet security suite as an excellent addition to your antivirus software or if you have determined that you don't need either.

Differentiating between an antivirus and an internet security suite is crucial. Virus and malware detection is a standard function of antivirus software. It's excellent at detecting malware that has already infiltrated your system. However, it usually won't do the following:

Control and monitor all incoming and outgoing data traffic using a sophisticated firewall. You may rest assured that your sensitive data will not be leaked to fraudsters in an automated fashion. Check all visited URLs against a blocklist of known phishing sites and alert users to or deny access to those sites if they appear on the list.

It's very uncommon to find antivirus software bundled with internet security suites, but these suites rarely include advanced system optimization utilities like garbage cleaners and disc defragmentation programs. Most Internet security suites aim to protect more than just viruses; this often includes blocking malware, spyware, rootkits, or spam.

These programs often connect with popular desktop email clients, so you can quickly and easily scan incoming and outgoing messages for threats. Downloading attachments from emails sent by unknown senders is now risk-free thanks to innovative features like mail gateways, which run scans on the files in a protected setting and only allow them to be downloaded after determining that they are not malicious.

1. Bitdefender Total Security

Bitdefender Total Security

Bitdefender's Total Protection mega-suite combines security components and extra features in one Windows application.


SPECIFICATIONS

+ Ransomware defense.

+ Optimize system.

+ Safe online payment browser.

+ Manages Passwords

+ VPN services

+ Childproofing


REASONS TO BUY

+ There's a free version available!

+ Advanced Malware Detection at Its Finest

+ A VPN service is included in all editions.

+ Conforms easily to your hardware requirements

+ Uses the International System for Protection as a backup


REASONS TO AVOID

+ Many popular browsers can't filter HTTPS.

+ A full VPN subscription required

+ Limited iOS support


After a while, even the most security-conscious users realize that antivirus software isn't adequate and start looking for a comprehensive package. However, not every suite is the same. Some include only the bare minimum of extra features. While others are jam-packed with functions, you wouldn't even think of as necessary.

However, some safeguard your computers and all your electronic gadgets. The Bitdefender Total Security suite is the company's premier product. It improves Bitdefender Internet Security's protections and makes them available on more platforms. The current Editors' Choice for security suites is Bitdefender Total Security.

This means enhancing system performance eliminating a lot of clutter from my computer, and speeding up my device. The VPN was just as fast and reliable as a dedicated service. The parental controls were flexible enough to accommodate my needs, right down to geofencing tracking my children's whereabouts. Unlike McAfee and Avira, which only provide anti-theft protection for mobile devices, I find it incredible that Bitdefender's offering also works on Windows systems.

Unfortunately, I can't say that Bitdefender is perfect. Its password organizer lacks a desktop interface, emergency access, and password sharing. The iOS mobile security software is underwhelming, offering only essential email breach monitoring and a restricted VPN service in addition to browser protection. Additionally, the 200 MB daily data cap on the VPN included with most Bitdefender services is insufficient even for light online browsing. However, Bitdefender Premium Security subscribers can access the complete data VPN service.

2. Norton 360

Norton 360

Norton 360 is a top 2022 antivirus application. It provides reasonable malware detection rates, real-time security, and many features.


SPECIFICATIONS

+ Real-time security

+ Scan viruses

+ VPN-safe

+ Firewall smart

+ Keylogger

+ Cloud-based PC backup.

+ SafeCam.


REASONS TO BUY

+ Rich feature set

+ 100% anti-malware

+ Secure VPN, password management

+ Great app

+ Child-safety features


REASONS TO AVOID

- Slow scans happen.

- Enhance security extras.

- No free version; not cheap


In 2022, Norton 360 will be widely regarded as a top-tier anti-malware suite. It is among the best at detecting malicious software, provides solid real-time security, and has more features than any other antivirus software. But what sort of protection does Norton's suite provide? In this review, we will not only investigate this antivirus in depth but also examine how it compares to other popular antivirus programs.

Norton Antivirus is not only wholly risk-free but also boasts an impressive track record of zero virus misses over many years. As recently as April 2022, in the most current period of testing by an impartial AV test, it only managed to earn a total of 6 points in all three categories of security, performance, and user-friendliness.

Said, Norton's security suite was the only one that successfully blocked every zero-day malware without causing false positives and slowing down the PC. This makes their defenses against viruses invincible.

Even after terminating the app's processes and unloading drivers, Norton 360 continues to work, as was discovered by other experts. Norton also passed a test using specially designed ransomware, with the antivirus program identifying the attack within seconds.


The first concern of those interested in antivirus programs is, of course, their level of safety. Additionally, Norton 360 has one of the best security suites available. It has protection against threats in real-time, a powerful firewall, and integration with Norton's virtual private network.

3. Kaspersky Internet Security

Kaspersky Internet Security

Antivirus testing labs recommend Kaspersky Internet Security. It's a suite with plenty of amenities.


SPECIFICATIONS

+ VPN

+ Firewall

+ Antispam


REASONS TO BUY

+ Four labs scored well

+ Application-controlling firewall

+ macOS and Android protection

+ Great vulnerability detection

+ Protecting webcams

+ Bonuses abound


REASONS TO AVOID

- Last test's antiphishing score fell.

- Performance affected


Without antivirus software, you're asking for trouble. A malicious virus could infect your system, a trojan could steal your financial information, and ransomware could encrypt all your files. Although installing antivirus software is essential, security measures shouldn't end there. Complete security provides safety on multiple fronts. An antivirus program that has won numerous awards is the basis for Kaspersky Internet Security, including a firewall, parental controls, spam filtering, a virtual private network, and other features. Moreover, each of these security measures is effective in what they were designed to do.

The Kaspersky Password Manager is a free add-on that may install alongside Kaspersky Internet Security if you choose. Kaspersky's free VPN software is also installed, providing daily data transfer limits of 300 MB.

It's not entirely clear what you expect if you ignore some of the other settings' recommendations. Still, they protect against a wide range of malware and PUPs and anything it could exploit to take remote control of your PC.

The suite comprises modules that will protect your online shopping while using a protected browser, restrict unwanted access to your webcam, and provide an ad- or tracker-blocking browser extension that also includes an on-screen keyboard to assist in avoiding keylogging. Additional Tools allow you to create rescue discs and run system optimization programs while gaming modes and high CPU and disc load detection keep you uninterrupted when gaming.

4. Avast Premium Security

Avast Premium Security

Avast Premium Security includes antivirus, firewalls, secure deletion, and other features.


SPECIFICATIONS

+ Security Suite

+ VPN

+ Firewall

+ Malware protection

+ Data breach monitoring


REASONS TO BUY

+ Good virus protection

+ Firewall protection

+ Android protection

+ Extra security features


REASONS TO AVOID

- Some bonuses cost extra.

- Limited macOS security

- iOS has poor security.

- Some features cost extra.


When it comes to antivirus software, Avast is a household name. Its primary selling point is that it provides exceptionally high levels of protection against all sorts of online dangers. It does more than scanning your devices; it also checks your network, safeguards your webcam, and prevents malicious content from being downloaded or accessed. In addition, it provides a Virtual Private Network (VPN) for private Internet use.

You give a lot of thought to safety if you are trying to find a reliable antivirus program. When you consider that Avast was caught selling customer data just last year, you might start to doubt how secure the software is.

After reading our review, you can decide whether or not it's worth installing Avast by learning more about its security features. As a spoiler, we may say that while Avast is a reliable virus removal program for basic security, we have tried and found other antivirus software, such as TotalAV, which offers much greater protection, privacy, and reputation.


As one might expect, many more bells and whistles are available on the more expensive plans. Although, it's nice to see a free version that's so comprehensive that it even has a firewall. And it finds malware just as effectively as premium subscriptions do.

But if you're looking for comprehensive security, Avast One is your best bet. You can cover 5 or 30 devices, and each level offers different features, such as protection against real-time threats, webcam monitoring, rogue websites, ransomware, and tracking.

5. F-Secure Antivirus SAFE

F-Secure Antivirus SAFE

Deep Guard behavior-based detection and web-traffic scanning make F-Secure Anti-Virus a strong malware fighter.


SPECIFICATIONS

+ Malware Scan

+ Malware Scan On-Demand

+ Child supervision

+ VPN

+ Password Management

+ Monitoring breaches


REASONS TO BUY

+ Good lab results

+ Good hands-on scores

+ Detects new ransomware

+ New interface

+ Inexpensive


REASONS TO AVOID

- Some ransomware samples escaped behavioral detection.

- Unprotected phishing


Antivirus software must be able to detect and eliminate existing malware, as well as safeguard against potential infections. In addition, some vendors provide so many extras that even the most basic antivirus program appears to be overkill. They cover you if you need a firewall, spam filter, or VPN. Instead, F-Secure Anti-Virus zeroes in on the essential goal of protecting your system from malware, including ransomware. It doesn't do anything to prevent your browser from visiting phishing sites, but it does block access to websites that host malware. It's a viable option if you need antivirus protection and doesn't care about the bells and whistles.


To combat malware, F-Secure employs a cutting-edge cloud-based anti-malware engine in a lightweight package. When I subjected it to a battery of malware and ransomware detection tests, it fared admirably, identifying 99.9 percent of the test files without affecting system performance. F-Secure not only delivers top-notch security for your online activities but also has a few handy extras.


Consumer anti-malware suites like F-Secure offer a variety of features beyond virus protection. At the time of installation, parents are presented with various options for restricting their children's access to the system and adjusting its content rating and age-appropriateness. Also, feel free to set up the program on a family member's computer younger than you.

Choosing a free antivirus package may appear like a budget-friendly option. Don't trust your data and devices to a free download without first considering how much it would cost to fix a severe infection that passes your free antivirus program. It's possible that specific free antivirus applications won't guard against as wide of a variety of threats as premium programs do, and it's also possible that updates to protect against new threats won't be accessible in free programs until much later than they are inexpensive ones.

As indicated in the article on software performance, several third-party organizations evaluate and report on security software performance. Learning about the differences between paid and free software might help you decide which software to install on your computer, tablet, or smartphone.

You shouldn't compromise Internet security. Free antivirus software can cost you if it doesn't guard against new internet threats. Investing in a reputable organization that detects, blocks, and removes malware is suitable for your digital security.
